Events.html: 502 – King Gundobad issues a new legal code (Lex Burgundionum) at Lyon that makes Gallo-Romans and Burgundians subject to the same laws.
Events.text: King Gundobad issues a new legal code (Lex Burgundionum) at Lyon that makes Gallo-Romans and Burgundians subject to the same laws.

Events.html: 1430 – The Ottoman Empire under Murad II captures the Byzantine city of Thessalonica.
Events.text: The Ottoman Empire under Murad II captures the Byzantine city of Thessalonica.

Events.html: 1461 – Wars of the Roses: Battle of Towton – Edward of York defeats Queen Margaret to become King Edward IV of England.
Events.text: Wars of the Roses: Battle of Towton – Edward of York defeats Queen Margaret to become King Edward IV of England.

Events.html: 1500 – Cesare Borgia is given the title of Captain General and Gonfalonier by his father Rodrigo Borgia after returning from his conquests in the Romagna.
Events.text: Cesare Borgia is given the title of Captain General and Gonfalonier by his father Rodrigo Borgia after returning from his conquests in the Romagna.

Events.html: 1549 – The city of Salvador da Bahia, the first capital of Brazil, is founded.
Events.text: The city of Salvador da Bahia, the first capital of Brazil, is founded.

Events.html: 1632 – Treaty of Saint-Germain is signed returning Quebec to French control after the English had seized it in 1629.
Events.text: Treaty of Saint-Germain is signed returning Quebec to French control after the English had seized it in 1629.

Events.html: 1638 – Swedish colonists establish the first European settlement in Delaware, naming it New Sweden.
Events.text: Swedish colonists establish the first European settlement in Delaware, naming it New Sweden.

Events.html: 1683 – Yaoya Oshichi, 15-year-old Japanese girl, burnt at the stake for an act of arson committed due to unrequited love.
Events.text: Yaoya Oshichi, 15-year-old Japanese girl, burnt at the stake for an act of arson committed due to unrequited love.

Events.html: 1792 – King Gustav III of Sweden dies after being shot in the back at a midnight masquerade ball at Stockholm's Royal Opera 13 days earlier. He is succeeded by Gustav IV Adolf.
Events.text: King Gustav III of Sweden dies after being shot in the back at a midnight masquerade ball at Stockholm's Royal Opera 13 days earlier. He is succeeded by Gustav IV Adolf.

Events.html: 1806 – Construction is authorized of the Great National Pike, better known as the Cumberland Road, becoming the first United States federal highway.
Events.text: Construction is authorized of the Great National Pike, better known as the Cumberland Road, becoming the first United States federal highway.

Events.html: 1809 – King Gustav IV Adolf of Sweden abdicates after a coup d'état. At the Diet of Porvoo, Finland's four Estates pledge allegiance to Alexander I of Russia, commencing the secession of the Grand Duchy of Finland from Sweden.
Events.text: King Gustav IV Adolf of Sweden abdicates after a coup d'état. At the Diet of Porvoo, Finland's four Estates pledge allegiance to Alexander I of Russia, commencing the secession of the Grand Duchy of Finland from Sweden.

Events.html: 1831 – Great Bosnian uprising: Bosniaks rebel against Turkey.
Events.text: Great Bosnian uprising: Bosniaks rebel against Turkey.

Events.html: 1847 – Mexican–American War: United States forces led by General Winfield Scott take Veracruz after a siege.
Events.text: Mexican–American War: United States forces led by General Winfield Scott take Veracruz after a siege.

Events.html: 1849 – The United Kingdom annexes the Punjab.
Events.text: The United Kingdom annexes the Punjab.

Events.html: 1857 – Sepoy Mangal Pandey of the 34th Regiment, Bengal Native Infantry mutinies against the East India Company's rule in India and inspires the protracted Indian Rebellion of 1857, also known as the Sepoy Mutiny.
Events.text: Sepoy Mangal Pandey of the 34th Regiment, Bengal Native Infantry mutinies against the East India Company's rule in India and inspires the protracted Indian Rebellion of 1857, also known as the Sepoy Mutiny.

Events.html: 1865 – American Civil War: Federal forces under Major General Philip Sheridan move to flank Confederate forces under Robert E. Lee as the Appomattox Campaign begins.
Events.text: American Civil War: Federal forces under Major General Philip Sheridan move to flank Confederate forces under Robert E. Lee as the Appomattox Campaign begins.

Events.html: 1867 – Queen Victoria gives Royal Assent to the British North America Act which establishes the Dominion of Canada on July 1.
Events.text: Queen Victoria gives Royal Assent to the British North America Act which establishes the Dominion of Canada on July 1.

Events.html: 1871 – The Royal Albert Hall is opened by Queen Victoria.
Events.text: The Royal Albert Hall is opened by Queen Victoria.

Events.html: 1879 – Anglo-Zulu War: Battle of Kambula: British forces defeat 20,000 Zulus.
Events.text: Anglo-Zulu War: Battle of Kambula: British forces defeat 20,000 Zulus.

Events.html: 1882 – The Knights of Columbus are established.
Events.text: The Knights of Columbus are established.

Events.html: 1886 – Dr. John Pemberton brews the first batch of Coca-Cola in a backyard in Atlanta, Georgia.
Events.text: Dr. John Pemberton brews the first batch of Coca-Cola in a backyard in Atlanta, Georgia.

Events.html: 1911 – The M1911 .45 ACP pistol becomes the official U.S. Army side arm.
Events.text: The M1911 .45 ACP pistol becomes the official U.S. Army side arm.

Events.html: 1930 – Heinrich Brüning is appointed German Reichskanzler.
Events.text: Heinrich Brüning is appointed German Reichskanzler.

Events.html: 1936 – In Germany, Adolf Hitler receives 99% of the votes in a referendum to ratify Germany's illegal reoccupation of the Rhineland, receiving 44.5 million votes out of 45.5 million registered voters.
Events.text: In Germany, Adolf Hitler receives 99% of the votes in a referendum to ratify Germany's illegal reoccupation of the Rhineland, receiving 44.5 million votes out of 45.5 million registered voters.

Events.html: 1941 – The North American Radio Broadcasting Agreement goes into effect at 03:00 local time.
Events.text: The North American Radio Broadcasting Agreement goes into effect at 03:00 local time.

Events.html: 1941 – World War II: British Royal Navy and Royal Australian Navy forces defeat those of the Italian Regia Marina off the Peloponnesian coast of Greece in the Battle of Cape Matapan.
Events.text: World War II: British Royal Navy and Royal Australian Navy forces defeat those of the Italian Regia Marina off the Peloponnesian coast of Greece in the Battle of Cape Matapan.

links.subject: British
links.title: Armed Forces of the United Kingdom

Events.html: 1942 – The Bombing of Lübeck in World War II is the first major success for the RAF Bomber Command against Germany and a German city.
Events.text: The Bombing of Lübeck in World War II is the first major success for the RAF Bomber Command against Germany and a German city.

links.subject: Bombing of Lübeck in World War II
links.title: Bombing of Lübeck in World War II

Events.html: 1945 – World War II: Last day of V-1 flying bomb attacks on England.
Events.text: World War II: Last day of V-1 flying bomb attacks on England.

Events.html: 1945 – World War II: The German 4th Army is almost destroyed by the Soviet Red Army.
Events.text: World War II: The German 4th Army is almost destroyed by the Soviet Red Army.

Events.html: 1946 – Instituto Tecnológico Autónomo de México, one of Mexico's leading universities, is founded.
Events.text: Instituto Tecnológico Autónomo de México, one of Mexico's leading universities, is founded.

Events.html: 1947 – Malagasy Uprising against French colonial rule in Madagascar.
Events.text: Malagasy Uprising against French colonial rule in Madagascar.

Events.html: 1951 – Ethel and Julius Rosenberg are convicted of conspiracy to commit espionage.
Events.text: Ethel and Julius Rosenberg are convicted of conspiracy to commit espionage.

Events.html: 1957 – The New York, Ontario and Western Railway makes its final run, the first major U.S. railroad to be abandoned in its entirety.
Events.text: The New York, Ontario and Western Railway makes its final run, the first major U.S. railroad to be abandoned in its entirety.

links.subject: New York, Ontario and Western Railway
links.title: New York, Ontario and Western Railway

Events.html: 1961 – The Twenty-third Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified, allowing residents of Washington, D.C., to vote in presidential elections.
Events.text: The Twenty-third Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified, allowing residents of Washington, D.C., to vote in presidential elections.

links.subject: Twenty-third Amendment to the United States Constitution
links.title: Twenty-third Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.html: 1962 – Arturo Frondizi, the president of Argentina, is overthrown in a military coup by Argentina's armed forces, ending an 11½ day constitutional crisis.
Events.text: Arturo Frondizi, the president of Argentina, is overthrown in a military coup by Argentina's armed forces, ending an 11½ day constitutional crisis.

Events.html: 1971 – My Lai massacre: Lieutenant William Calley is convicted of premeditated murder and sentenced to life in prison.
Events.text: My Lai massacre: Lieutenant William Calley is convicted of premeditated murder and sentenced to life in prison.

Events.html: 1971 – A Los Angeles, California jury recommends the death penalty for Charles Manson and three female followers.
Events.text: A Los Angeles, California jury recommends the death penalty for Charles Manson and three female followers.

Events.html: 1973 – Vietnam War: The last United States combat soldiers leave South Vietnam.
Events.text: Vietnam War: The last United States combat soldiers leave South Vietnam.

Events.html: 1973 – Operation Barrel Roll, a covert US bombing campaign in Laos to stop communist infiltration of South Vietnam, ends.
Events.text: Operation Barrel Roll, a covert US bombing campaign in Laos to stop communist infiltration of South Vietnam, ends.

Events.html: 1974 – NASA's Mariner 10 becomes the first spaceprobe to fly by Mercury.
Events.text: NASA's Mariner 10 becomes the first spaceprobe to fly by Mercury.

Events.html: 1974 – Local farmers in Lintong District, Xi'an, Shaanxi province, China, discover the Terracotta Army that was buried with Qin Shi Huang, the first Emperor of China, in the third century BCE.
Events.text: Local farmers in Lintong District, Xi'an, Shaanxi province, China, discover the Terracotta Army that was buried with Qin Shi Huang, the first Emperor of China, in the third century BCE.

Events.html: 1982 – The Canada Act 1982 (U.K.) receives the Royal Assent from Queen Elizabeth II, setting the stage for the Queen of Canada to proclaim the Constitution Act, 1982.
Events.text: The Canada Act 1982 (U.K.) receives the Royal Assent from Queen Elizabeth II, setting the stage for the Queen of Canada to proclaim the Constitution Act, 1982.

links.subject: Queen Elizabeth II
links.title: Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom

Events.html: 1984 – The Baltimore Colts load its possessions onto fifteen Mayflower moving trucks in the early morning hours and transfer its operations to Indianapolis.
Events.text: The Baltimore Colts load its possessions onto fifteen Mayflower moving trucks in the early morning hours and transfer its operations to Indianapolis.

Events.html: 1990 – The Czechoslovak parliament is unable to reach an agreement on what to call the country after the fall of Communism, sparking the so-called Hyphen War.
Events.text: The Czechoslovak parliament is unable to reach an agreement on what to call the country after the fall of Communism, sparking the so-called Hyphen War.

Events.html: 1993 – Catherine Callbeck becomes premier of Prince Edward Island and the first woman to be elected in a general election as premier of a Canadian province.
Events.text: Catherine Callbeck becomes premier of Prince Edward Island and the first woman to be elected in a general election as premier of a Canadian province.

Events.html: 1999 – The Dow Jones Industrial Average closes above the 10,000 mark (10,006.78) for the first time, during the height of the internet boom.
Events.text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closes above the 10,000 mark (10,006.78) for the first time, during the height of the internet boom.

Events.html: 1999 – A magnitude 6.8 earthquake strikes the Chamoli district in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh, killing 103.
Events.text: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake strikes the Chamoli district in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh, killing 103.

Events.html: 2002 – In reaction to the Passover massacre two days prior, Israel launches Operation Defensive Shield against Palestinian militants, its largest military operation in the West Bank since the 1967 Six-Day War.
Events.text: In reaction to the Passover massacre two days prior, Israel launches Operation Defensive Shield against Palestinian militants, its largest military operation in the West Bank since the 1967 Six-Day War.

Events.html: 2004 – Bulgaria, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Romania, Slovakia and Slovenia join NATO as full members.
Events.text: Bulgaria, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Romania, Slovakia and Slovenia join NATO as full members.

Events.html: 2004 – The Republic of Ireland becomes the first country in the world to ban smoking in all work places, including bars and restaurants.
Events.text: The Republic of Ireland becomes the first country in the world to ban smoking in all work places, including bars and restaurants.

Events.html: 2010 – Two female suicide bombers hit the Moscow Metro system at the peak of the morning rush hour, killing 40.
Events.text: Two female suicide bombers hit the Moscow Metro system at the peak of the morning rush hour, killing 40.

Events.html: 2013 – At least 36 people are killed when a 16-floor building collapses in the commercial capital Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.
Events.text: At least 36 people are killed when a 16-floor building collapses in the commercial capital Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.

Events.html: 2013 – A landslide kills 66 people in China's Tibetan Autonomous Region near Lhasa.
Events.text: A landslide kills 66 people in China's Tibetan Autonomous Region near Lhasa.

Events.html: 2014 – The first same-sex marriages in England and Wales are performed.
Events.text: The first same-sex marriages in England and Wales are performed.

links.subject: same-sex marriages
links.title: Same-sex marriage in the United Kingdom
